flow.title: Getting Started with Python

objectives: Students can write basic Python programs
Students understand Python syntax and data types
Students can use variables and perform basic operations

content.title: What is Python?
content.body: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity and readability. Created by Guido van Rossum in 1991, Python emphasizes code readability and allows programmers to express concepts in fewer lines of code.

content.title: Python Installation and Setup
content.transcript: Welcome to Python programming! In this video, we'll install Python and set up your development environment...

content.code:
# Your first Python program
print("Hello, World!")

# Variables and data types
name = "Alice"
age = 25
height = 5.6
is_student = True

print(f"Name: {name}, Age: {age}")
content.explanation: This example shows basic Python syntax: comments, print statements, variables, and string formatting.

flow.summary: Python is a beginner-friendly language with clean syntax. We've learned about variables, basic data types, and how to run our first Python program.
